title: Unit, Zero, Equal Matrices and Transposition
description: ## Unit, Zero, Equal Matrices and Transposition
Solve the following exercises on special matrices and matrix transposition. Show all your work and provide detailed explanations.
**a)** What are the dimensions of O₂ₓ₃?
**b)** What are the dimensions of O₃ₓ₂?
**c)** Is O₂ₓ₃ equal to O₃ₓ₂? Explain why or why not.
**d)** What is the result when you add O₂ₓ₃ to any 2×3 matrix?
**a)** What are the dimensions of I₂?
**b)** What are the dimensions of I₃?
**c)** What happens when you multiply any 2×2 matrix A by I₂?
**d)** What happens when you multiply I₃ by any 3×3 matrix B?
Determine whether the following pairs of matrices are equal:
Find the transpose of each matrix:
**d)** Is (AB)ᵀ equal to AᵀBᵀ? (Assume AB is defined)
hints: Zero matrices contain only zero elements and come in different sizes.
Identity matrices are square matrices with 1s on the main diagonal and 0s elsewhere.
Two matrices are equal only if they have the same dimensions and identical corresponding elements.
The transpose of a matrix is obtained by interchanging its rows and columns.
The identity matrix Iₙ has 1s on the main diagonal and 0s elsewhere
The zero matrix contains all zero elements
Matrix transposition swaps rows and columns: (Aᵀ)[i][j] = A[j][i]
Double transposition returns the original matrix: (Aᵀ)ᵀ = A
Two matrices are equal if they have the same dimensions and identical elements
solution: ## Solutions to Unit, Zero, Equal Matrices and Transposition Exercises
**c)** No, O₂ₓ₃ and O₃ₓ₂ are not equal because they have different dimensions (2×3 vs 3×2).
**d)** Adding O₂ₓ₃ to any 2×3 matrix leaves the matrix unchanged (additive identity).
**c)** A × I₂ = A (multiplicative identity on the right).
**d)** I₃ × B = B (multiplicative identity on the left).
**a)** Yes, matrices A and B are equal (same dimensions and identical elements).
**b)** No, matrices C and D are not equal (different element arrangements).
**c)** Yes, matrices E and F are equal (same row matrix).
**d)** No, matrices G and H are not equal (G is column matrix, H is row matrix).
